revised_title: Tungsten Surface Reactions with Water Vapor and Oxygen
tldr: The authors studied the reaction of water vapor with evaporated tungsten films and found that the tungsten surface exposed to excess water becomes covered with adsorbed hydroxyl groups. Further adsorption of water with the evolution of hydrogen occurs at higher temperatures. The interaction of water with tungsten leads to oxidation of the metal with the formation of hydrogen at 300°C. The study provides insights into the nature of the catalytically active surface of treated tungsten.
